thread.title: Europe's top five scorers under the age of 21 revealed - with just one Premier League star making the cut
thread.title_full: Europe's top five scorers under the age of 21 revealed - with just one Premier League star making the cut

author: James Whaling
title: Europe's top five scorers under the age of 21 revealed - with just one Premier League star making the cut
text:
Sport LONDON, ENGLAND - MARCH 19: Dele Alli of Tottenham Hotspur scores his sides second goal from the penalty spot during the Premier League match between Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton at White Hart Lane on March 19, 2017 in London, England. (Photo by Warren Little/Getty Images) (Photo: Warren Little) Share Get football   
Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli is the only Premier League player to feature in the top five scorers under the age of 21 in Europe's top leagues so far this season. 
The Spurs and England playmaker has struck on 14 occasions for his club in the top flight so far this term. 
He ranks sixth in the Premier League goal charts and is the highest-placed midfielder. 
Only strikers Romelu Lukaku, Harry Kane, Alexis Sanchez, Diego Costa and Zlatan Ibrahimovic have found the net with more regularity than Alli in the current campaign. 
But who else makes the top five? Look no further... 5. Serge Gnabry Gnabry has 10 goals so far this term (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
Here's a name familiar to English football fans - particularly those of an Arsenal persuasion. 
Gnabry left the Gunners for Werder Bremen last summer and gas kick started his career in Germany. 
He has 10 league goals so far this term in 21 appearances helping Werder to a mid-table position. 4. Giovanni Simeone Simeone (top right) has impressed for Genoa (Photo: Marco Luzzani / Getty) 
Simeone left River Plate in his native Argentina for Serie A side Genoa in the summer and has hit the ground running in Italy. 
The 21-year-old has struck on 10 occasions in 27 outings so far including a brace against leaders Juventus in Genoa's 3-1 win in November. 
His goals have steered his side away from a relegation scrap, sitting just two places but 14 points clear of the drop zone. 3. Kylian Mbappe Mbappe's form has seen him earn a France call-up (Photo: REUTERS) 
Monaco starlet Mbappe has shot to prominence this season with his displays for the Ligue 1 side. 
He has 12 goals in 22 games in the league and impressed in Europe as Monaco knocked out Manchester City in the Champions League. 
His goals have led to comparisons with Thierry Henry and attracted interest from a host of big clubs in England and on the continent. 2. Dele Alli Alli is the Premier League's sole representative (Photo: REUTERS) 
Alli is the sole Premier League representative in the top five scorers under the age of 21 in Europe's top leagues. 
The Spurs star has hit 14 goals from midfield this term helping Tottenham to second in the Premier League behind runaway leaders Chelsea. 
He is in the England squad for the Three Lions' fixtures against Germany and Lithuania in the coming days. 1. Timo Werner Werner has gone from strength to strength with Leipzig (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
Werner had already racked up over 100 career appearances for Stuttgart before moving to RB Leipzig over the summer. 
He managed just 13 Bundesliga goals in 95 outings for Stuttgart but has already bettered that tally in the current campaign, netting 14 times in 24 matches. 
His form has seen him earn a first senior call-up for Germany and he is in the squad for the clash against England on Wednesday and the World Cup qualifier against Azerbaijan four days later. poll loading Will Dele Alli score against Germany on Wednesday? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
